intro: Psychotria pubigera, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareta," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine conditions. Psychotria pubigera is also noted for its use in traditional medicine and its ecological importance in its native habitat.
